pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:0.5.eng: 58. The training rule on making stains

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū ca paribbājakā ca sāketā sāvatthiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannā honti. Antarāmagge corā nikkhamitvā te acchindiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.2.eng: a number of monks and wanderers were robbed while traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.3.pli: Sāvatthiyā rājabhaṭā nikkhamitvā te core sabhaṇḍe gahetvā bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pāhesuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.3.eng: The king’s men set out from Sāvatthī and caught the thieves and their loot. They then sent a message to the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.4.pli: “āgacchantu, bhadantā, sakaṃ sakaṃ cīvaraṃ sañjānitvā gaṇhantū”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.4.eng: “Venerables, please come and pick out your own robes.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.5.eng: But the monks did not recognize them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.6.eng: The people complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā attano attano cīvaraṃ na sañjānissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.7.eng: “How can they not recognize their own robes?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.8.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.8.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā bhikkhūnaṃ tadanucchavikaṃ tadanulomikaṃ dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.10.eng: He had the Sangha gathered, gave a teaching on what is right and proper, and then addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.11.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.11.eng: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the following ten reasons:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.12.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.13.eng: for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.14.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.14.eng: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.15.1.pli: “Navaṃ pana bhikkhunā cīvaralābhena tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇaṃ ādātabbaṃ—nīlaṃ vā kaddamaṃ vā kāḷasāmaṃ vā. Anādā ce bhikkhu tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇaṃ navaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:1.15.1.eng: ‘When a monk gets a new robe, he should apply one of three kinds of stains: blue-green, mud-color, or dark brown. If a monk uses a new robe without applying any of the three kinds of stains, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.2.eng: a mark has not been made is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.4.eng: one of the six kinds of robes.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.4.comm: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see Kd 8:3.1.6.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.5.eng: He should apply one of three kinds of stains:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.6.eng: even if he just applies what fits on the tip of a blade of grass.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.8.eng: there are two kinds of blue-green: the color of copper sulfate and the color of leaves.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.10.comm: According to Vin-vn-ṭ 1626 (presumably commenting on kaddamena in Kkh): Kaddamenāti udakānukaddamasukkhakaddamādiṁ saṅgaṇhāti, “With mud means: water with mud, dry mud, etc., is included.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.13.pli: Anādā ce bhikkhu tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇanti
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.13.eng: If a monk … without applying any of the three kinds of stains:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.14.pli: antamaso kusaggenapi anādiyitvā tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇaṃ navaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.1.14.eng: if he uses a new robe without first applying one of the three kinds of stains, even just the amount on the tip of a blade of grass, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.2.1.eng: If it has not been applied, and he perceives that it has not, and he uses the robe, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.2.2.eng: If it has not been applied, but he is unsure of it, and he uses the robe, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.2.3.eng: If it has not been applied, but he perceives that it has, and he uses the robe, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.2.4.eng: If it has been applied, but he perceives that it has not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.2.5.eng: If it has been applied, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.2.6.eng: If it has been applied, and he perceives that it has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.3.2.eng: if he applies the stain and then uses it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.3.4.eng: if the area where the mark was applied is worn;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.3.5.eng: if what had been marked is sewn together with what has not been marked;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.3.7.eng: if it is a lengthwise border;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.3.7.comm: I understand anuvāta and paribhaṇḍa to refer to long borders and short borders respectively.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.3.8.eng: if it is a crosswise border;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.3.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc58:2.3.11.eng: The training rule on making stains, the eighth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:0.5.eng: 59. The training rule on assigning ownership to another

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto bhātuno saddhivihārikassa bhikkhuno sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ vikappetvā appaccuddhāraṇaṃ paribhuñjati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.2.eng: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan assigned the ownership of a robe to a monk who was his brother’s student. He then used that robe without that monk having relinquished it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.3.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.4.pli: “ayaṃ, āvuso, āyasmā upanando sakyaputto mayhaṃ cīvaraṃ sāmaṃ vikappetvā appaccuddhāraṇaṃ paribhuñjatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.4.eng: “Venerable Upananda is using a robe that he had assigned to me, even though I haven’t relinquished it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.5.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.5.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ vikappetvā appaccuddhāraṇaṃ paribhuñjissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.6.eng: “How could Venerable Upananda use a robe he had assigned to a monk, without that monk first relinquishing it?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, upananda, bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ vikappetvā appaccuddhāraṇaṃ paribhuñjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.7.eng: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.10.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ vikappetvā appaccuddhāraṇaṃ paribhuñjissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.10.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.12.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.12.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.13.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā sikkhamānāya vā sāmaṇerassa vā sāmaṇeriyā vā sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ vikappetvā appaccuddhāraṇaṃ paribhuñjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:1.13.1.eng: ‘If a monk himself assigns the ownership of a robe to a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, or a novice nun, and he then uses it without the other first relinquishing it, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.8.eng: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.10.eng: one training for two years in the six rules.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.12.eng: a male training in the ten training rules.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.14.eng: a female training in the ten training rules.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.18.pli: channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ vikappanupagaṃ pacchimaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.18.eng: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be assigned to another.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.18.comm: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see Kd 8:3.1.6. According to Kd 8:21.1.4 the size referred to is no smaller than 8 by 4 sugataṅgula, “standard fingerbreadths”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.20.pli: dve vikappanā— sammukhāvikappanā ca parammukhāvikappanā ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.20.eng: there are two kinds of assignment: assignment in the presence of and assignment in the absence of.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.20.comm: For an explanation of the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.22.eng: one should say, “I assign this robe-cloth to you,” or “I assign this robe-cloth to so-and-so.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.24.eng: one should say, “I give this robe-cloth to you for the purpose of assigning it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.25.pli: Tena vattabbo— “ko te mitto vā sandiṭṭho vā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.25.eng: The other should ask, “Who is your friend or companion?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.27.pli: Tena vattabbo— “ahaṃ tesaṃ dammi, tesaṃ santakaṃ paribhuñja vā vissajjehi vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karohī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.27.eng: The other should say, “I give it to them. Please use their property, give it away, or do as you like with it.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.27.comm: This seems to be a reference to vissāsa, the idea of “taking on trust”. If you have an agreement with a close friend, you may take their belongings on trust. In this particular case, you assign the robe-cloth to such a friend, which then enables you to take the robe-cloth back should you need it. (The place where the robe-cloth is stored seems to be irrelevant.) This explains why the other monk says, “Please use their property, give it away, or do as you like with it.” The conditions for taking on trust are set out at Kd 8:19.1.5.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.29.pli: tassa vā adinnaṃ, tassa vā avissasanto paribhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.1.29.eng: if it is not given to him or he uses it without taking it on trust, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.1.eng: If it has not been relinquished, and he perceives that it has not, and he uses it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.2.eng: If it has not been relinquished, but he is unsure of it, and he uses it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.3.eng: If it has not been relinquished, but he perceives that it has, and he uses it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.3.comm: The Pali here reads appaccuddhāraṇasaññī , which must be an editing mistake. I instead follow the PTS reading, paccuddhāraṇasaññī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.4.pli: Adhiṭṭheti vā vissajjeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.4.eng: If he determines it or gives it away, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.5.eng: If it has been relinquished, but he perceives that it has not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.6.eng: If it has been relinquished, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.2.7.eng: If it has been relinquished, and he perceives that it has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.3.2.eng: if the other person gives it or he uses it after taking the other person’s property on trust;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.3.5.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc59:2.3.6.eng: The training rule on assigning ownership to another, the ninth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:0.5.eng: 6. The second training rule on the same sleeping place

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā anuruddho kosalesu janapade sāvatthiṃ gacchanto sāyaṃ aññataraṃ gāmaṃ upagacchi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.2.eng: Venerable Anuruddha was walking through the Kosalan country on his way to Sāvatthī, when one evening he arrived at a certain village.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tasmiṃ gāme aññatarissā itthiyā āvasathāgāraṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.3.eng: Just then a woman in that village had prepared her guesthouse.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.3.comm: Sp 2.55: Āvasathāgāranti āgantukānaṁ vasanāgāraṁ, “A house for visitors to stay.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho yena sā itthī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ itthiṃ etadavoca—“sace te, bhagini, agaru, vaseyyāma ekarattaṃ āvasathāgāre”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.4.eng: Anuruddha went to that woman and said, “If it’s not inconvenient for you, I’d like to stay in your guesthouse for one night.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.6.pli: Aññepi addhikā yena sā itthī tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ itthiṃ etadavocuṃ—“sace te, ayye, agaru vaseyyāma ekarattaṃ āvasathāgāre”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.6.eng: Other travelers also went to that woman and said, “Ma’am, if it’s not troublesome for you, we’d like to stay in your guesthouse for one night.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.7.pli: “Eso kho ayyo samaṇo paṭhamaṃ upagato; sace so anujānāti, vaseyyāthā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.7.eng: “Sirs, a monastic is already staying there. If he agrees, you may stay.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.8.pli: Atha kho te addhikā yenāyasmā anuruddho tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ etadavocuṃ—“sace te, bhante, agaru, vaseyyāma ekarattaṃ āvasathāgāre”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.8.eng: Those travelers then approached Anuruddha and said, “If you don’t mind, venerable, we’d like to stay one night in the guesthouse.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.10.pli: Atha kho sā itthī āyasmante anuruddhe saha dassanena paṭibaddhacittā ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.10.eng: Now as soon as that woman had seen Anuruddha, she had fallen in love with him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.11.pli: Atha kho sā itthī yenāyasmā anuruddho tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ etadavoca—“ayyo, bhante, imehi manussehi ākiṇṇo na phāsu viharissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.11.eng: She now went to him and said, “Sir, you won’t be comfortable surrounded by these people.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.12.pli: Sādhāhaṃ, bhante, ayyassa mañcakaṃ abbhantaraṃ paññapeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.12.eng: Why don’t I prepare a bed for you in the main house?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.14.pli: Atha kho sā itthī āyasmato anuruddhassa mañcakaṃ abbhantaraṃ paññapetvā alaṅkatappaṭiyattā gandhagandhinī yenāyasmā anuruddho tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.14.eng: After preparing a bed in the main house, she put on jewelery and perfume, and she went to Anuruddha and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.15.pli: “ayyo, bhante, abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko, ahañcamhi abhirūpā dassanīyā pāsādikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.15.eng: “You’re attractive, sir, and so am I.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.16.eng: Why don’t you take me as your wife?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.17.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā anuruddho tuṇhī ahosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.18.eng: She said the same thing a second time, but again got no response.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.19.pli: tatiyampi kho sā itthī āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.19.eng: And a third time she said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.20.pli: “ayyo, bhante, abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko, ahañcamhi abhirūpā dassanīyā pāsādikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.20.eng: “You’re attractive, sir, and so am I.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.21.pli: Sādhu, bhante, ayyo mañceva paṭicchatu sabbañca sāpateyyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.21.eng: Why don’t you take me and all this property?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.22.pli: Tatiyampi kho āyasmā anuruddho tuṇhī ahosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.23.pli: Atha kho sā itthī sāṭakaṃ nikkhipitvā āyasmato anuruddhassa purato caṅkamatipi tiṭṭhatipi nisīdatipi seyyampi kappeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.23.eng: She then threw off her wrap, and she walked back and forth, stood, sat down, and lay down in front of him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.24.pli: Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho indriyāni okkhipitvā taṃ itthiṃ neva olokesi napi ālapi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.24.eng: But Anuruddha controlled his senses and neither looked at nor spoke to her.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.25.pli: Atha kho sā itthī—“acchariyaṃ vata bho, abbhutaṃ vata bho.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.25.eng: Then that woman said, “It’s astonishing and amazing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.26.pli: Bahū me manussā satenapi sahassenapi pahiṇanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.26.eng: Many people pay a hundred or a thousand coins to be with me.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.27.pli: Ayaṃ pana samaṇo—mayā sāmaṃ yāciyamāno—na icchati mañceva paṭicchituṃ sabbañca sāpateyyan”ti
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.27.eng: But this monastic doesn’t want me and all this property, even when I beg him!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.28.pli: sāṭakaṃ nivāsetvā āyasmato anuruddhassa pādesu sirasā nipatitvā āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.28.eng: After dressing, she bowed down with her head at Anuruddha’s feet and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.29.pli: “accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ yāhaṃ evamakāsiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.29.eng: “Sir, I’ve made a mistake. I’ve been foolish, confused, and unskillful.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.30.pli: Tassā me, bhante, ayyo accayaṃ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu āyatiṃ saṃvarāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.30.eng: Please forgive me so that I may restrain myself in the future.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.31.pli: “Taggha tvaṃ, bhagini, accayo accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ yā tvaṃ evamakāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.31.eng: “You have certainly made a mistake. You’ve been foolish, confused, and unskillful.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.32.pli: Yato ca kho tvaṃ, bhagini, accayaṃ accayato disvā yathādhammaṃ paṭikarosi, taṃ te mayaṃ paṭiggaṇhāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.32.eng: But since you acknowledge your mistake and make proper amends, I forgive you.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.33.pli: Vuddhi hesā, bhagini, ariyassa vinaye yo accayaṃ accayato disvā yathādhammaṃ paṭikaroti āyatiñca saṃvaraṃ āpajjatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.33.eng: For this is called growth in the training of the noble ones: acknowledging a mistake, making proper amends, and undertaking restraint for the future.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.33.comm: “Training” renders vinaya. See Appendix of Technical Terms for a discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.34.pli: Atha kho sā itthī tassā rattiyā accayena āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā, āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ bhuttāviṃ onītapattapāṇiṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.34.eng: The following morning that woman personally served and satisfied Anuruddha with various kinds of fine foods. When he had finished his meal, she bowed and sat down to one side.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.35.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho taṃ itthiṃ āyasmā anuruddho dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.35.eng: And Anuruddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened her with a teaching.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.36.pli: Atha kho sā itthī—āyasmatā anuruddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā—āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.38.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya—‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.38.eng: Just as one might set upright what’s overturned, or reveal what’s hidden, or show the way to one who’s lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what is there—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.39.pli: evamevaṃ ayyena anuruddhena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.39.eng: just so has the Buddha made the Teaching clear in many ways.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.40.pli: Esāhaṃ, bhante, taṃ bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.40.eng: I go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.41.pli: Upāsikaṃ maṃ ayyo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.41.eng: Please accept me as a lay follower who’s gone for refuge for life.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.42.pli: Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.42.eng: Soon afterwards, after arriving at Sāvatthī, Anuruddha told the monks what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.43.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.43.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.44.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā anuruddho mātugāmena sahaseyyaṃ kappessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.44.eng: “How can Venerable Anuruddha lie down in the same sleeping place as a woman?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.45.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.45.eng: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Anuruddha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.46.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, anuruddha, mātugāmena sahaseyyaṃ kappesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.46.eng: “Is it true, Anuruddha, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.48.pli: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā …pe… kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, anuruddha, mātugāmena sahaseyyaṃ kappessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.48.eng: The Buddha rebuked him … “Anuruddha, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.50.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.50.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.51.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmena sahaseyyaṃ kappeyya pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.51.1.eng: ‘If a monk lies down in the same sleeping place as a woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.6.pli: manussitthī, na yakkhī, na petī, na tiracchānagatā; antamaso tadahujātāpi dārikā, pageva mahattarī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.6.eng: a female human being, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal; even a girl born on that very day, let alone an older one.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.10.eng: fully roofed, fully walled; mostly roofed, mostly walled.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.11.eng: Lies down in the same sleeping place:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.13.pli: Mātugāme nipanne bhikkhu nipajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.13.eng: if the monk lies down when the woman is already lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.14.pli: Bhikkhu nipanne mātugāmo nipajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.14.eng: if the woman lies down when the monk is already lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.15.eng: if they both lie down together, he commits an offense entailing confession;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.16.eng: every time they get up and then lie down again, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.1.pli: Mātugāme mātugāmasaññī sahaseyyaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.1.eng: If it is a woman, and he perceives her as such, and he lies down in the same sleeping place as her, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.2.pli: Mātugāme vematiko sahaseyyaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.2.eng: If it is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he lies down in the same sleeping place as her, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.3.pli: Mātugāme amātugāmasaññī sahaseyyaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.3.eng: If it is a woman, but he does not perceive her as such, and he lies down in the same sleeping place as her, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.4.eng: If it is half-roofed and half-walled, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.5.pli: Yakkhiyā vā petiyā vā paṇḍakena vā tiracchānagatitthiyā vā sahaseyyaṃ kappeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.5.eng: If he lies down in the same sleeping place as a female spirit, a female ghost, a paṇḍaka, or a female animal, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.6.eng: If it is not a woman, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.7.eng: If it is not a woman, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.8.eng: If it is not a woman, and he does not perceive them as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.2.eng: if it is fully roofed, but not walled;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.3.eng: if it is fully walled, but not roofed;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.4.eng: if it is mostly not roofed;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.5.eng: if it is mostly not walled;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.6.eng: if the monk sits when the woman is lying down;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.7.eng: if the woman sits when the monk is lying down;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.8.eng: if they both sit down together;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.11.eng: The second training rule on the same sleeping place, the sixth, is finished.
